Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman the Animated Series Promo Cards
Description:
From the critically acclaimed Batman animated series, these 3 Dice Masters cards depict Batman and his allies. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Batgirl: Carrying the Mantle (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman)
    Batman: "I am the Night"
    Robin: Reckoning


Batgirl and Batman use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman, Robin uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest.
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman the Animated Series Sirens Promo Cards
Description:
From the critically acclaimed Batman animated series, these 3 Dice Masters cards depict some of the femme fatales from the DC Animated Universe. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Talia al Ghul: Off-Balance
    Catwoman: The Cat and The Claw
    Poison Ivy: Eternal Youth


Talia al Ghul and Catwoman use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman, and Poison Ivy uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest.
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman the Animated Series Villains Promo Cards
Description:
From the critically acclaimed Batman animated series, these 3 Dice Masters cards depict some of the most iconic villains Batman battled on the small screen. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Harley Quinn: Tough Cookie (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman)
    The Joker: The Laughing Fish
    The Riddler: If You're So Smart, Why Aren't You Rich?


All three use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman.
Families: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Archers Promo Cards
Description:
Team Arrow takes aim at your opponents with these 3 Dice Masters cards. Use Green Arrow, Roy Harper, and Focus Power for the win.  Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Focus Power: Basic Action Card (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men)
    Green Arrow: Archery Advocate
    Roy Harper: Adolescent Archer


Focus Power can be used with any Basic Action Dice, Green Arrow and Roy Harper use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash.

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Speedsters Promo Cards
Description:
You'll want to get your hands on these 3 Dice Masters cards - and fast! Tap into the speedforce like never before with Jay Garrick, The Flash, and Professor Zoom. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Jay Garrick: Leadfoot (Blank Art/Sketch Card Alternate for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash)
    Barry Allen: Fastest Man Alive
    Professor Zoom: Thief


All three use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash.

Name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Crisis on Infinite Earths Promo Cards
Description:
Crisis on Infinite Earths is one of the most well known comic stories of all time - now enjoy it with theses 3 Dice Masters cards. Add versions of Superman, Supergirl, and The Flash to your next team to give your opponent a crisis. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Superman: Invulnerable (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest)
    Supergirl: Crisis on Infinite Earths
    The Flash: Crisis on Infinite Earths


Superman and Supergirl use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest, The Flash uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Justice Like Lightning Promo Cards
Description:
The Thunderbolts are heroes… but truly villains… with a shot at redemption! Collect these 3 Dice Masters cards to make Baron Zemo, Villainous Pact, and Ant-Man part of your next team. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Villainous Pact (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League)
    Ant-Man: Tiny Regret
    Baron Zemo: Citizen V


Villainous Pact can be used with any Basic Action Dice, Ant-Man and Baron Zemo use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Marvel Knights Promo Cards
Description:
Black Widow, Daredevil, and the Punisher don't always work together, but when they do it's in the pages of Marvel Knights - or on your next Dice Masters team! Contains 3 cards. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Black Widow: Stinger (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man)
    Daredevil: Marvel Knight
    Punisher: Marvel Knight


Black Widow and Daredevil use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man, Punisher uses the die from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Thanos Imperative Promo Cards
Description:
Capture the epic story of the Thanos Imperative through these 3 Dice Masters cards. Add Nova, Star-Lord, and Thanos to your next game. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Star-Lord: Reluctant Prince (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron)
    Nova: Nova Prime
    Thanos: Gauntlet Wielder


Star-Lord and Thanos use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron, Nova uses the die from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Classic Avengers Promo Cards
Description:
With a distinctive retro art style, this set features 3 Dice Masters cards of original Avengers - Ant-Man, Captain America, and Iron Man! Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Iron Man: Pro-Reg (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War)
    Ant-Man: Classic Avenger
    Captain America: Classic Avenger


All three cards use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War.

Name: Marvel Dice Masters: Ms. Marvel Promo Cards
Description:
Ms. Marvel grew up in a world with superheroes - now she's become one! With these 3 Dice Masters cards you can play Ms. Marvel alongside her hero Carol and her pal Loki. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


    Captain Marvel: Captain Carol Danvers (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War)
    Ms. Marvel: Amazing Hero
    Loki: Angsty Asgardian


All three cards use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War.

Name: Conflicted: Survive The Apocalypse
Description:
The world is coming to an end, and every aspect of your survival depends on your strategic thinking, cunning, negotiating skills and your sense of humor!

Start as a leader, someone with the skills and courage to confront a post-apocalyptic world and all its new challenges head on. To attract others to your cause you’ll need to give them a reason to do it. As one of dozens of unique leaders, you’ll need to amass unique assets such as The Hydroponic Farm, The Gunsmith’s Shop, and The Abandoned Surgeon’s Office and others. Every asset has unique abilities which will enable you to attract other survivors to your cause.

Survivors will rally to your cause once they have someone who can lead them and provide food and shelter. They’ll fight and die for you and others in the camp. However, they aren’t simple pawns in a game of survival, each one of these people have unique skills and abilities which can change outcomes of battles and effects of disasters. You’ll team up with dozens of unique survivors, such as The Young Patriots, Kim the Farmer and or Jose The Welder or several others. Each survivor has unique sets of skills you can combine in order to help you prosper and stay alive.

Once you have assets and people, you’ll need to equip them properly. Barter with other players or use the Trade Post and equip your followers with everything from a Shank and Molotov Cocktails to Drones and Gatling Guns or one of dozens of other unique pieces of gear. Each equipment has special abilities and effects that can turn the tides of war with a roll of the dice.

Once you have something worth taking, others will come for it. Those who believe in taking other than earning their keep will be even more brutal and hungry after the collapse of society. You’ll need to defend your survivor compound against attackers of all kinds, everyone from Biker Gangs and Hungry Mobs to Your Crazy Neighbor and an Angry Drunken Dwarf and a lot more.

The local government will notice your growing power and they will exercise their right to take control of everything you’ve built. They’ll send everything from The Marines and The National Guard to The Diplomat and The Property Tax Collector. Will you let them take what they want, fight them off or try to join them?

In the midst of it all, keep your guard up against other Leaders who will try to expand their influence by taking you out of the game. Use whatever destiny sends your way in the form of Chance Cards such as The Voodoo Doll, Lightning Bolt and a Runaway Goat to try stay on top and win the game.

Nature, accidents and the unexpected will also try to wipe you out. Pandemics, Heart Attacks, Ebola, Earthquakes and Nuclear Attacks are just a few of the catastrophes only the prepared will survive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monster Misfits:  Battle Pack
Description:
Add more strategy to your Monster Misfits Game with this 50 Card Expansion Pack.
Give your Monsters Weapons, Potions, Curses and other Items to make an epic battle!
Battle Pack also comes with all new Chaos Cards and more Monsters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Caballeros y Castillos
Description:
"This game simulates on a board the continuous territorial wars that devastated Europe during the Middle Ages, seasoned with a little magic. In the game you must wisely manage your resources (gold, wood, iron) so that you can form armies and equip them in the armouries and stables that you will have to build.

If you do it well, you will conquer new territories with new resources. Castles, Wizards, Archers and Knights are also part of the game; use them with a good strategy and remember that there can only be one King, so...."

—description from the publisher

Each player controls a capital and starts the game with 2 infantry units, 1 archer, 1 garrison counter and 1 armoury.

The game lasts a maximum of 24 turns.

In his turn, each player can do the following actions in any order he wants:


     Collect production from all their territories
     Acquire constructions
     Purchase units
     Move your units around the board


Combat is resolved using custom six-sided dice.

To win you have to conquer a number of capitals or territories depending on the number of players. If all 24 turns are exhausted and no player has won, then the winner will be the player with the most territories and capitals.

Name: Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits
Description:
Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits is a 3 to 6 player game where you play politicians using creative bribery, or inventive blackmail to manipulate ordinary peeps of Breggsit Island and gain their support. Draw cards from the deck to construct the perfect most hilarious bribe or the most devious cunning and poignant blackmail to suit your target and ward off any counter bribes from the competition.

This adorable hilarious Board Game satirizes the ridiculous nature of modern politics and campaigning. Enjoy rich original artwork, easy to learn, enjoyable game play and hilarious in game mechanics.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arena: The Contest – Heroic Defense
Description: Heroic Defense is a Heroic Action card from Arena: The Contest. The promo card was designed as give-away for Spiel '17 in Essen in a quantity of 1,500 pieces.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Take Me To Your Leader
Description:
This expansion contains five one-piece miniatures representing these powerful heroes from the Mars Attacks universe, so you can use them in your games.

Contains:
Craig, Tunga, Beloss Bel, Standard-bearer, Regent supreme.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Attack on Greenville
Description:
This expansion contains five one-piece miniatures representing these powerful heroes from the Mars Attacks universe, so you can use them in your games.

Contains:
Don Manning, Esteban Ramirez, General Tor, Blaine, Martian zombie.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Giant Martian Robot
Description: This expansion contains: 1 Martian Robot

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Giant Mutant Spider
Description:
This expansion contains:
1 Giant mutant spider, 1 Bug Trainer from the Science Division.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Giant Mutant Ant
Description:
This expansion contains:
1 Giant Mutant Ant, 1 Bug Trainer from the Science Division.

Name: UFM: Football Highlights
Description:
UFM: Football Highlights is the first game of the series of board games about the football (soccer) club management.

It's about the best moments of football matches.

You are the manager of one of the two underdog (mediocre) clubs which eager to be real glory hunters.

In the game, you have to determine the formation of footballers on the field, give instructions to players, strengthen the team by newcomers, learn and use new formations. There are referees, red cards, injuries, penalties, substitutions and everything is like in real football.

You have to rise from mediocre team to the winner of the first UFM trophy - Underdogs Cup.

Game components are divided into 5 envelopes. In each of those is the card of the referee appointed for the upcoming match, new or additional components, as well as brief rules on how to use them. The scenario and rules will become more complicated with the growth of your experience. In the final you have to fight for the Underdogs Cup.

In first envelope you get team with 15 players and the most popular formation 4-4-2. Each player has attack and defend skills. There are also cards "match events" and referee card. Every referee has own preferences. First one is loyal. There are in the game different referees: strict, very strict, unfair, undecided, etc.

You don't need to play full match. Instead of it you have to play 3 attacks, named "highlights", in every time of match. "Highlight" is finished when goal scored or team lost the ball. All footballers lay face down in starting formation and attacking manager choose one of them and open his card. Defending manager choose one of his players and open his card in front of attacking player. Then they roll dices (d10) and add result to attack and defend accordingly to their players. After each "highlight" you have to open "match event" card. And make all actions from it. Every effect of "match events" depends on the referee of the match.

In the next envelopes you get "team instructions" cards which helps to affect actions at the field and to decrease random.

After completing the scenario with Underdogs Cup, you will get more freedom to act. You can open the last envelope with additional formations, referees, and game currency. For this money you can buy your own players. There will be also stickers to improve skills of your players and tournament cards for playing your own tournaments.

Underdog - the weakest of two or more rivals. Literally meaning is "lower dog". The term arose by the end of the XIX century in the US during the dog fights. Often losing dog usually lies next to the paws of the winner or literally under it. The more surprising thing was its unexpected victory over a strong opponent.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – US Soldiers Flatbed
Description:
This expansion contains:
1 Plastic truck that includes: Civil model, Military model.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Saucer Squadron
Description:
This expansion contains:
3 Martian UFO's, with a selection of weapons: deadly heat rays or terrifying freezing rays! 6 heat rays, 6 freezing rays, 3 pilot options on command, 3 enhanced communications options, 3 transparent plastic domes, 3 plastic bases.

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Attack Saucer
Description:
This expansion contains:
2 Rays of heat, 2 Freezing rays, Pilot control option, Enhanced communications option, Transparent plastic dome, Plastic base.

Name: Befuddled, Bemused & Bewildered
Description:
The Senior Moments Game
Just as you think you have more in common with stale bread (you need replacing and you’re only good for toasting), along comes Befuddled, Bemused & Bewildered, the game that will tell you if there’s life in the old dog yet, or confirm what others have been telling you for years: you’re well past your sell-by date.

Packed with quirky questions that will blow the cobwebs from between your ears, heaving with hilarious challenges to get you on your feet (let’s face it, you need the exercise…), take a gentle amble around the game board with every card you draw…

—description from the publisher

Name: Who do you think you are?
Description:
Prove your detective skills in this brain-teasing board game based on the BBC's hit show Who Do You Think You Are? Clues about celebrities’ family trees are hidden around the world. The first player to piece them together and uncover all of the ancestral secrets is crowned winner!

After hearing about the mysteries a celebrity wants to solve, move your aeroplane along the global flight paths. Every time you land, check the ancestry book for relevant clues. It’s your goal to combine information from several sources and use your powers of deduction to get the correct answers. With the roll of the dice you can even hide hints from the other players and get double clues to help you zoom ahead.

Whilst the celebrities are fictional, the history is accurate. Marvel at stories that are by turns funny, gruesome and exciting! Go back in time as you discover how our shared history has shaped the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: OX the Game
Description:
OX is a two-player, portable, table top game which combines strategy and luck. It's fast and addictive.
 The aim of OX is to get all of your counters across the board before your opponent, this is done by moving counters according to the roll of the dice. Depending on your roll, you can move one or two counters and attack your opponent, defend yourself or simply get your counters across the board.  It becomes a battle in which you try and both advance your counters forward and push your opponents back.

The game is made of leather and wood and rolls up to make it portable. The game involves the leather board itself with a wooden centre piece, 16 counters and a pair of dice.

—description from the designer

Name: Primeval: A Tribal Supplement
Description:
Primeval is a prehistoric gaming supplement for the Tribal rules - a skirmish-style wargame which focuses on the heroic deeds of units and individuals in battle. Primeval continues the theme of 'honour' as a fundamental element of tribal life and combat - which determines who actually 'wins' a game, through the actions of the protagonists in battle.

Primeval goes back to the ere of the Dawn of Man, when humanity was first establishing itself across the harsh landscapes of a prehistoric world. Humanity's fight for survival and ultimately supremacy provides a world of interesting gaming opportunities! The constantly emerging finds in the field, which challenges us all to reassess who we are, and where we come from, inspired us to research and game in the era of Primeval man.

In Primeval there are: new skills (including rules for dog companions); 4 new prehistoric factions (Neanderthal, Cro-Magnon, Hominids and Denisovans); 4 new scenarios; a mini-campaign called 'The Hunt'; and rules for playing animals in scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Torii
Description:
Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by "Miniaturas y Wargames" to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)

In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.
Families: History: Kamakura Period to Muromachi Period

Name: Tash-Kalar: Arena of Legends – Etherweave
Description:
Arcane beings transform the arena, intertwining space and time, bringing visions of things yet to come. You play with the threads of causality itself when you embrace the tactics of

Etherweave!

In the third expansion to Tash-Kalar, you will discover beings with effects that can travel backwards through time. These warp effects can be played even before the being's pattern is formed. But beware! Leaving loose threads does have its consequences. You must summon the being to fulfill the fate that your tactics have foreseen.

Name: Polemos Napoleonic Companion
Description: This supplement to the Polemos Napoleonic rules adds more scenarios, army generators, a campaign system including a sample campaign scenario and map. It also includes a period glossary and orders of battle for the various armies.

Name: Hoksaa!
Description:
Hoksaa! is a quick pattern recognition game. Game board is a circle built on puzzle pieces with easy and harder side. The game play consists of rolling a special die that will tell players what to search this round. Some examples: blue things, loud things, square things. Sandtimer is flipped, and players try to find as many of matching things during that time and mark them with their pieces.

—user summary

Name: Word Rush
Description:
Place nine letter cards on the game board, turn a category card and set the timer in motion. You have to come up with words using one of the letters, but the longer you take, the more time the next player will have.

Once a player cannot come up with a word, they lose one point. Everyone starts with three points and continue until there is a winner.

—user summary

Name: Wobbly Worm
Description: Children's dexterity game. Either place or throw a ring around the battery-operated snake's head. Difficulty can be adjusted by adding or removing pieces to the snake.

Name: Just Desserts: Just Coffee
Description: Just Coffee adds six new edibles from tiramisu to chocolate-covered espresso beans and four new customers (including the shaky but very enthusiastic Mr. Jitters) to the Just Desserts base game.

Name: Icebreaker Snow
Description:
Based on the animation of the same name, Icebreaker Snow is a cooperative board game, where players try to pilot all ships to harbor before the deck runs out.

To pilot a ship home, one ice breaker has to be on same location with the ship, and another on the destination harbor.

Name: Staccups
Description: Race your opponent against the clock to see who is the fastest at stacking their cups! Colour co-ordinated, this fast-paced game is all about reaction times and hand eye co-ordination. Will you be the first to stop the clock with your cups colour co-ordinated? Great fun for all the family!

Name: Five Little Fish
Description:
Fish or Frog, what’s hiding under the Lily Pads? It’s a classic game of matching with a clever twist that will keep parents and children guessing.  Flip a Lily Pad Card to see which fish you need to catch. Use a Fishing Rod to hook the fish you think will match.  Reel it in to reveal its telescoping colored tail. If it’s a match, you keep the catch! Pay close attention! If you flip over Grumpy Frog’s Lily Pad, you throw a fish back. Can you remember which one’s which? Catch the most fish to win!


    Place all the Little Fish in the center of the table so the heads face up, and the telescoping tails are tucked inside.
    Shuffle the Little Fish so no one knows which one’s which and put the Fishing Rods to the side.
    Shuffle the Lily Pad cards and lay them face down around the Little Fish.
    The youngest player goes first!  Start by turning over a Lily Pad Card of your choice.  If the Lily Pad shows a…
        Fish – Take a Fishing Rod, choose any one of the Little Fish on the table and hook it with the Fishing Rod.  Lift the Little Fish so that everyone can see which colored body falls out from underneath the head.  
            If it matches the fish shown on the Lily Pad Card, place it down on the table in front of you, making sure to collapse the body back inside its head.  
            If there is no match, then the Little Fish you chose remains in its current position.
        
        Rainbow Fish – Choose ANY one of the Little Fish and drag it in front of you.  Do NOT lift it up and reveal the color of the body.  If there are no Little Fish in the middle of the table, then you may take one Little Fish sitting in front of another player, careful to not reveal the body of the Little Fish.
        Grumpy Frog – Bad Luck!  Push one of your Little Fish from in front of you back in the middle of the table.  Do NOT lift it up and reveal the colored body inside.  If you don’t have a Little Fish in front of you then nothing happens and your turn is over.
    
    If you turn over a Lily Pad card that reveals a Little Fish that you think is already in front of you, then you can use a Fishing Rod to lift it up and show the match.  If you’re correct, you may turn over another Lily Pad Card and have another turn.  If you do not reveal the matching Little Fish, your turn is over.
    The game ends when all the Lily Pad Cards have been discarded.  The player with the most fish in front of them wins! If it’s a tie, players will check the tail tips of their Little Fish – the player with the highest number on their Little Fish wins the game!

Name: Peikkovuori
Description:
The game is played as two teams, both trying to escape from troll mountain. First players have to collect enough cards to repair the route, and then move through the route to safety. But beware, the troll might catch you. Then you will have to start your escape from the beginning again. The first team to get all their figures to safety is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Kumite: The Wargame
Description:
Kumite is a miniature game that recreates KO fights between elite fighters from all over the world, who practice various martial arts and want to rise to victory to become the best fighter in the world.

The first thing you must do is to create your fighter, choosing its nationality, corpulence and style of martial arts; this will change its attributes and provide you with favorable and unfavorable actions. Then create your deck of cards with 40 of the techniques your fighter will use to attack or defend from the 108 available. After this, to the tatami!

The game works with a system of successes in rolls of dice, throwing as many as it’s indicated in the value of the attribute to use, being successes 4, 5 and 6. The fighters move in a squared board using their techniques every round , having an active turn and a passive turn where both fighters can attack and defend themselves.

The game will be won by the player who manages to reduce the opponent's Stamina attribute to 0, or after 15 rounds of play, the one that has subtracted more Stamina to his opponent.

—description from the designer

Name: MoMo & Friend Running Up & Down
Description:
MoMo & Friend is a speedy and funny party game that challenges your cognitive skill. Are you ready to activate your brain?

Are you ready to activate your brain for listen the comment, visual process the cards, reasoning skill to make a right decision in a second?

The dealer plays a card and gives a command: either “UP”, “DOWN” or “STAY”, then all other players will play a card with the correct “Button” number, which matches to the “Floor” number and command just given.

Be careful, it’s easy to make mistakes!
Let’s train our brains together!

This game includes and advanced mode.

Name: Oodles of Utils
Description:
Oodles of Utils is a tabletop boardgame that has been developed to encourage players to have fun while discussing 'tribal priorities' chosen blindly at the start of the game.  These tribes each prioritises two of the four points (Money, Health, fun and Goodwill) and are then rewarded at the end of the game for having 'lived' according to their 'tribes' priorities.

The game is competitive and cooperative, which creates a warm atmosphere and brings out the best in players.

The game is a two sided board, where players throw the dice and move around the board along the path. When players throw doubles they may move forward or backwards. There are 3 levels of play, from 13+ (younger with assistance). The game takes approximately 2 hrs, depending on how much discussions people have.  The game player numbers are three to six. Five players are optimal.

The goal of the game is to earn priority points by making decisions based on your tribal priorities. Lower value points may be traded with other players, thus creating an opportunity to cooperation with other players for a win/win outcome.

—description from the designer

Name: This One Time, I...: The Game of Ludicrous Life Choices – Party Edition
Description:
Have you ever hooked up with someone within an hour of meeting them, or blacked out before 9 p.m. because you were too drunk?
 Unlike most of the party games you have played, THIS ONE TIME, I... provides an explicit, hilarious opportunity for friends to relive their funny, dirty and downright crazy life experiences. We have probed deep into the dirty pasts of people to compile hundreds of ludicrous life choices that we can all relate to.
 The game is played with Confession Cards, which are examples of ludicrous life choices, and Rule Cards which tell you how to play each round - that make it easy and fun to learn who’s the craziest, dirtiest, wildest friend of the group!

Every round, a player selects a Red Rule Card from the top of the pile, reads the instructions aloud and must then do as the Rule Card says.
 If you are guilty of an act detailed by a Blue Confession Card given to you, you must add it to your losing pile (face up) in front of you until the end of the game, so that everyone can enjoy reliving your bad decisions. If you are not guilty of a Confession Card, you must scrap it.
 The first player to have 10 Confession Cards in their losing pile loses the game. There are no winners in this game, only losers.

—description from the publisher

Name: What Do You Meme?: Basic Bitch Pack
Description: The Basic Bitch expansion pack includes 50 caption cards and 15 photo cards. You can add them to main deck and play with more friends and family members.

Name: Legacy of the Stars
Description:
Legacy of the Stars is a space empire-building game in which you take control of one of eight factions racing to rebuild human civilization after a devastating galactic civil war. Your goal is to be the faction whose legacy will shape humanity's future by collecting Legacy Cards representing your accomplishments. 
 The core mechanic involves playing action cards from your hand to gather the game's three resource types, spend those resources on ships, outposts, cities, and technology, and move your ships to engage in combat or conquest.

There are six different kinds of Legacy Card: Expansion (having outposts on lots of planets), Empire (having lots of cities), Enlightenment (researching high-level technology), Extermination (destroying cities and outposts during conquest), Exploration (devoting resources to the renovation of derelict warp gates), and the Exalted (destroying "Exalted Guardians", which are the ancient autonomous war machines that still protect a few special planets).

The first player to collect 8 Legacy Cards is the winner. Players track their progress on the Legacy Track, which triggers events whenever the first player reaches each new legacy total.

—description from the designer

Name: Boss Monster: Totale Zerstörung!
Description:
Boss Monster: Totale Zerstörung! is an expansion in the world of Boss Monster. More information pending from the publisher.

The game is essentially a collection of the following 3 games/expansions, translated into german:

     Boss Monster: Crash Landing
     Boss Monster: Implements of Destruction 
     Boss Monster: Tools of Hero-Kind

Name: Replicants!
Description: Replicants! is a Scifi themed resource gathering game for most ages. Each round you deal out a new resource grid, then players take turns placing their drones on the grid to collect the corresponding resources and then use them to level up their Replicants in order to gain victory points, abilities and of course, more Replicants. It is a relatively fast paced game that is half turn based and half simultaneous play that accommodates 2-6 player and takes 45minutes to an hour to play.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Drog's Special Reserve
Description:
Promo drink card for Red Dragon Inn

1 Alcohol content
-1 Fortitude

Drog's Special Reserve

Shuffle your discard pile into your character deck.

Made from only the finest body parts!

As of August 2017, Drog’s Special Reserve is only available (along with The Red Dragon Inn: Chronos the Time Mage) as part of The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport.

Name: NewSpeak: Dead Drop
Description: In NewSpeak: Dead Drop dissident players have access to limited visual information in the form of a hand of picture cards, items that can be 'hidden' in different locations to give them an edge over the moderators. The moderators will have to contend with one piece of information which is hidden, rather than completely open information in the dissident conversation, allowing the dissidents to give creative and cryptic clues in their speaking round.

Name: Reset!
Description: The fast & crazy game of triangle cards! Green means go, but watch out for the reset cards or you lose a turn! To win, you've got to be the first to get rid of your cards by being strategic and getting others to reset before they can place a card. Triangle cards emphasize where you can play your cards. Sometimes in your favor and others not. The corners of the triangles point to the areas of the playmat you can use. Includes 105 triangle cards of multiple colors and printed playing mat.

Name: Alphabet Island: A Letters and Sounds Game
Description:
This is an educational game for children learning to match lowercase and uppercase letters or learning letter sounds.  There are two levels of play, level one using the matching letters and level two using the sounds.

The theme is alphabet island and the game includes a hungry shark, ready to eat all the letters.

To play you take turns flipping over a card and revealing a capital letter.  Then all players race to find the disc with the correspondent lower case letter, or picture/word stating with the sound of that letter.  The first person to find it gets to keep that disc and the person with the most discs at the end wins.

To enhance the game play there are starfish, crabs and the shark.  If you find a disc that uncovers a starfish you must give one of your discs to another player.  If you find a crab you get to take one from someone else, and if you flip over a shark card you must feed a disk to the hungry shark.  (There are four shark cards in the deck.)   The shark is a 3D plastic toy with a lever on the back that allows the shark to actually eat the disks.

The instructions come in English, French, Spanish and German and you could play level one in any of those languages, but to play level 2 you have to play in English.

Name: Behold, A Pale Glider
Description:
10 May 1940: a handful of German troops landed atop Belgium's strongest fort using gliders (painted light blue underneath to match the sky) and took it out.  This two player game simulates this key event in the fall of France.  Each turn is 10 minutes and each ground unit is about 10 men.

This is a postcard game that was released from LPS POCKET BATTLE game No. 18

Name: Za
Description:
Za is a fully-collaborative crossword building game. Players pull objective cards from the Za deck, plus a selection of letter tiles, and work together to build a crossword that satisfies the objectives. Whenever they do, they draw more letter tiles and objectives.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pinocchio Mini
Description:
Pinocchio Mini: True Or False is a storytelling game that helps you to get to know your friends and family better. You might discover a lot of funny things about them you didn’t know about!

600 different topics to stimulate the storyteller to tell infinite life stories.

The active player chooses 1 topic to share his/her relevant experience (true story) or to make up a story (lie story), then place the corresponding True/Lie card face down on the table. After telling the story, other players can pay 1 Angel token to ask a question to check the authenticity, then guess the story is true or lie. Who guesses wrong will stack up a nose token on his/her Pinocchio head. To increase to excitement if half or more players have guessed correctly, the storyteller has to stack a nose token also.

Game continues until all players finish to tell a story, the shortest nose Pinocchio will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Harukichi
Description:
A seasoned and cunning tactician in all affairs. His razor sharp mind and unflinching resolve make Harukichi an exceptional businessman and leader. Those in his gumi display an unshakable faith in his decisions and follow his orders without question or pause. Those who follow the Five Fortunes believe that you make your own luck and this is particularly true in Harukichi’s case. It appears to his enemies that should Harukichi will it his followers are able to achieve the most unlikely feats, whilst their own trip, stumble and flail wildly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Manu
Description:
This giant Buto is the personal bodyguard of Harukichi and was selected for obvious reasons. His prowess in the Jumo arenas quickly attracted attention, it was clear to most he was destined for a top position within the Syndicate, and he has not disappointed. Constantly vigilant to any threat, and unshakeable in his devotion to the defence of his Oyabun, Manu has continuously put himself in harm’s way, catching most would be assassins off guard with his prowess in melee, deftly blocking blows until his master is safe, then and only then the time comes to crush bones with fists the size of mallets.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Micro Game
Description:
The 19th century empires of Russia and Britian engaged in a series of strategic conflicts in Central Asia known as The Great Game. Relive that history in only 18 cards.

Based loosely on the COIN system, the Great Micro Game features a solitaire variant known as K1M (Kiplings 1-Player Mode). Despite the name, this allows you to play as either the British or Russian Empires.

Originally an Entry for the 2015 18-Card Microgame Contest and the Mint Tin Contest, it won 1st place for Top 3 Designs by Guest Judge Chris Hansen.

There are two editions of the game in the files section:
Core Edition - This is the original entry that won the Mint Tin Contest Guest Judge Award. This is the more play-tested game and will likely be a better solo play experience
Alternate Edition - This edition has a video explanation, some thematic tweaks, and a different rule set. I recommend this edition if you want to learn by video.

Name: Team Wordz
Description:
Which team has the biggest vocabulary and can find the most words for each category in Team Wordz?

Both team players place their points tablets face-down on that round's categories. Roll the letter-dice: which team can think up two words for each category in 60 seconds? The time is up and the points tablets are revealed; the more categories there are with two dice on them, the more points you get. Whoever has the most points at the end wins.

Name: Mein cooles Dino-Spiel
Description: Each player chooses a dinosaur skeleton outline and places it in front of him/her on the table. The dinosaur bones are placed into a fabric bag. Now the players have to find the matching bones for their dinosaur without looking. They roll the die and according to the number thrown they may take 1, 2 or 3 dino bones from the fabric bag or put the bones together which they have already found. The game ends as soon as one of the players has completely assembled his/her dino.

Name: The Legend of Korra: Pro-Bending Arena – Amon's Invasion
Description:
Amon's Invasion is an expansion for The Legend of Korra: Pro-bending Arena. The expansion adds 3 modes to your core game.

Mode 1: "And the Winner is..." is a Co-Op scenario where players join forces to fight off Amon's Equalist forces.

Mode 2: Avatar Korra (Solo Bender) lets a player be Avatar Korra and play her as a single team or incorporate her into "And the Winner is..." with another player controlling to other benders.

Mode 3: Villain: Amon (Solo Bender) lets a player control Amon and his equalist minions.
Families: TV Shows: Avatar The Last Airbender/Legend of Korra

Name: GooaAAAal!: Junior Pack
Description:
GooaAAAal! Junior Pack is a soccer dice game made for 2 players (it can actually be played with more players as soon as each player has got 4 dice)
It comes with twice 4 dice, each having 6 faces (1 BALL, 1 GOALKEEPER, 2 FANS, 1 MISSED SHOT and 1 PENALTY)

The one who scores more goals wins

There are 2 main ways to score.
during a 3 throws period Draw a line between the players. One player rolls his dice and decide wether he can/want to place BALL and GOALKEEPER on the line. The opponent does the same. The one having more BALLS than the opponent has GOALKEEPER at the end of the period scores the equivalent number of points. Some faces provide support (FAN), some other not (MISSED SHOT) and some may give an extra chance to score (PENALTY)

during a PENALTY KICK OUT The quickest to roll, obtain the 4 faces PENALTY, assemble them properly, and show them up shouting GooaAAAal! wins. Either he scores 1 point or stops the ball !!

A game is traditionally played in 2 periods, with extra time of 3 throws if needed.

Name: Doomtown: Too Tough To Die
Description:
Too Tough to Die is the first expansion for Doomtown to follow There Comes a Reckoning and begins the Tombstone Trilogy. Featuring four copies of 56 new cards, this expansion expands Doomtown to Tombstone, Arizona during the legendary conflict between the Cowboys and the Earps. In Death’s domain, tensions are high and the body count is higher. Whose fight will you join in this high-stakes battle for the soul of the town that’s Too Tough to Die?

Doomtown is a fastâ€‘paced expandable card game set in the Deadlands™ universe of gun slingin’, spell slingin’, and mud-slingin’!

With 56 new cards, Too Tough to Die gives you new ways to customize your Doomtown decks. Whether your style is shootin’, spell castin’, or just trying to show that you have more money and influence than the next person, Too Tough to Die expands your options in Tombstone!

Name: Ninja Soul
Description:
Ninja Soul is a microgame consisting of eight cards. Each player gets dealt one card face down. During their turn, a player can either look at their own card, exchange a card with another player or reveal the card in front of them, executing the action the card contains. 
When a player executes the effect of the "winning" card, they get three points, all other survivors receive one point. First player to reach ten points is the winner.

Name: Majestik
Description:
Each player commands a different team of acrobats. All teams work together in the great artistic performance of human columns. In this performance, acrobats climb over each other to form columns with up to 10 artists "performers".

Players can built simultaneously up to five of these human columns. Although the columns are built together, teams compete with each other for the public recognition that comes in the form of applause.

An act (one game round) ends when at least two columns are completed. At this point the audience applauds enthusiastically.
Obviously these applauses are directed to the teams whose acrobats have participated the most on the completed columns. Then these artists leave the scene to get some rest.

Acrobats that participate in the incomplete columns remain on the scene and also receive applause for their teams; after all supporting artists also have their importance in the show.
The whole show lasts for three acts. In the end of the third act the "grand finale" takes place. Each player scores its last applause points and some bonus points are awarded too.

The player, whose team has most impressed the audience during tonight’s presentation (gathered the most applause points) will be the winner.

Name: Cutie Race
Description:
Please, ready your vehicle, "Cutie Race" is about to start!
Wait, you're still don't know what the “Cutie Race“ is?
In this spectacular competition Cuties will try to find out, who is the fastest, smartest and dexterous one. But no, this is not your ordinary race! Fans must help Cuties by lots different gadgets and… feed them with donuts. Because Cuties loooove donuts!

Cutie Race is a fast-playing family style game, where each player tries to win by bidding the most on the winner of the race, but each bid the player will make will slow down his candidate. Moreover, everybody bids in secret at the beginning of each round and can use special bonuses to spice the game up! But a player must be careful in spending his resources, as he has only 3 chips per round (each is double-sided and can be used as a bid or as a bonus). The game ends in the round, where the finish line was crossed by one of the cuties and the player with the biggest bid on it wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Yogi: Free demo version
Description:
Given away for free at GenCon and other events.

Features 8 cards - 4 from the full Yogi game, 4 with flipped art and unique instructions.

There is also an advert card and an instruction card.

The intention is for 1 player to try to do all 8 things at once.

Name: Tremble, Humans!
Description:
Have you ever tried to develop a plan to enslave the whole human race? Come to the command center! Here you are going to learn from true experts in this field—our extraterrestrial comrades.
For example, you can try your hand at the tabletop strategic simulator. Try on the alien captain’s uniform and send your squadron to attack the Earth to capture as many people as possible. Because, you know, those humans are the most valuable resource in the whole universe.
Capture people, exchange them for alien warships, fight other captains to carry out missions from alien command and thus—capture even more of these pathetic humans!

Tremble, Humans! is a highly thematic board game, where players take roles of alien generals, invading earth to fill their cargo with intergalactic currency – humans. Each turn of the game some cites are available for attacks and players simultaneously choose a place to attack, splitting their fleet between cites, if necessary. But one city is too small for two generals – so if there are multiple players trying to invade a city, their armies will fight and only the strongest will capture the humans! After the round, generals can buy support – new ships and stations are available for purchase, as well as the amount of fuel will increase during invasion, making alien fleets larger. After 8 rounds and additional goals scoring the richest player wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: VENOM Assault: Walker
Description:
This the limited promo card from the Freedom Squadron RPG.

During the Tactical Phase: Discard one VENOM Support Solider and lower the VENOM Leaders health by 1

Combat Phase: add +1 to the rolled value of all combat dice with a value of 1 or 2.  When combating Hex or Shadow Staff, instead count these five as automatic Successes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Piper & Ava Go Hiking
Description:
In this solo adventure, you, Piper, will travel the five regions of the United States with your little doggie Ava. You must plan the trip using your vast organization skills and then hike the trails using your dexterity of mind and body.

Obstacles and adventures will surely arise during your trip. You will have to weather the storms, find a lost sheep, meet friends along the way, or you may find gold while hiking.

Adventure awaits on this trip of a lifetime!

During each of the five rounds(US regions) you will construct a hand of cards to go hiking by discarding cards from hand to gain the cards needed. After assembling your hand, you will have to assemble the cards in a card tower(trip) using the dice (Piper/you), black cubes (Ava/dog), and possibly other objects depending on events drawn during your hand assembly. You must complete all five regions of the USA using this set collection and dexterity before the deck runs out or your tower(trip) falls more than twice to win the game.

Contents:
50 State Cards
14 Events
5 D6 Dice (Piper/you)
1 D6 die (Ava/dog)
5 Black Cubes (Ava/dog)
12 Other Wooden Event Pieces

Name: Les aventuriers
Description: Your adventurer must find a path into jungle. If he finds a treasure, hide it. at the end of the game, the adventurer with the most points wins the game.

Name: DIG: The Chef
Description: The Chef is a cross-promo card for DIG depicting the chef from Feeding Zombies. This companion allows you to cancel an attack, whether it comes from a player or a gallery, by discarding ten crystals.

Name: European War Game Series: The French Army
Description:
A sequel to the Parker Bros. Great European War Game, this is a standalone "shoot 'em up" game where the targets are soldiers and officers of the WWI French Army. The cardboard soldiers are 6" high; the mounted officers just over 7" high and the cloth flag on pole rises to 8".

The most interesting feature of this game is the muzzle-loading cannon used for shooting. The hollow wooden barrel, 4.75" long, has a spring-loaded knob at the breech connected to a wooden pusher inside the barrel. Wooden bullets are loaded at the muzzle and ejected when the knob is released.

Name: Scoffton
Description:
Welcome to Scoffton, can we get you some bread?
You have just stepped back in time into the worst All You Can Eat buffet in town, Scoffton. Nothing has changed here since 1985, including the prawns!
Will you have the intestinal fortitude to bring home the bacon in this souper restaurant romp by gaining the most Value For Money points?
Plan ahead by matching recipes on the Menu Selection cards to score serious Value For Money!
Push your luck at the Claw Machine for the chance to win RAD prizes! 
Win the game by being the player to extract the most Value For Money from this less than salubrious establishment all whilst avoiding Management’s shameless attempts to fill you up on bread. 
And whatever you do don’t eat the poisoned prawn!

Scoffton is the worker placement game of belly management that takes about 60 minutes to play and can accommodate 2-4 players, age 10+.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Ballistic Missile Wars
Description:
"Two rival space outpost's try to knock over the opponent's space fleet, but there is a new angle!  Missiles must rebound off of back or sides of game board to hit targets.  Play area measures 15 3/4 x 13 1/4 x 2 1/2 inches high.  Plastic.  Imported.  For 2 Players. ... For ages 5 years to Adult"

—description from the Sears Christmas Catalog 1983, page 585

Each player takes turns firing spring loaded cannon at the other player's ships.  A BB would arc across the tilted play area and land on the opponent's side, hopefully hitting their ship.  If hit, the ship would flip over revealing an explosion sticker.

While the official rules encouraged alternating one shot at a time, shots could be fired rapidly, with only your BB supply the limiting factor.  As your opponent also fired it would replenish.

Similar to Epoch's 1974 Torpedo game, but with a self recycling ball mechanism that removes the fuss and set up of that game.

—user summary

Name: Omegaland
Description:
Omegaland is a game built around a tarot deck themed after a Mad Max type of world.

Omegaland situates tarot in a dystopian world where resources are scarce and violence is rampant. Society has been brought to its knees but humanity and hope manage to shine through in this intense 78-card tarot deck. With fascinating back stories in the 52-page booklet, urban warriors give their unique perspectives on the Fool’s journey through the Omegaland landscape.

Omegaland also includes game instructions for a strategic trick-taking game by Karen Boginski. Deck includes six additional cards with gameplay hints, goals, powers, and scoring guidelines.

—description from the publisher

Name: Intrigues of Asgard
Description:
Intrigues of Asgard is fast playing card-drafting game set in the Norse Pantheon mythology. In order to lease the gods, players will make offering to them by playing cards to their tableau. Each card contains two goods - and player must decide, which of them will be prayed in this turn. At the end of the round all gods are returning favours, but only to the most generous player, granting him one time use special ability or some victory points. After 3 rounds of the game all gods score one more time - and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blots
Description:
Blots is a new monster-themed party game in which players try to explain as many words as they can in under one minute. There are six different methods of explanation--and you will use all of them during the game! The game also features six levels of difficulty and a major twist: players do not split into teams, but each time players guess a word, that pair of players advance their marker on the score track. At the end of the game, the winner will be that pair of players who best understand each other in the process.

—description from the publisher (paraphrased)

Name: WTF: Whisky Table Friends
Description:
WTF: Whisky Table Friends is a fast-playing card game playing under 15 minutes. The goal of the game is to have least points, and to do that you must play cards from you hand.

—description from the publisher

WTF (Whiskey Table Friends) is a card game, played over three rounds, in which players try to avoid getting penalty points. 
Each round all cards are distributed to the players. The cards represent a value between 3 and 30. Of each type of cards there are as many cards as 60 divided by the value of the cardtype: e.g. 20 cards of value "3", 2 cards of value "30".
In his turn, the starting player plays as many cards (min.1) of the same value as he wishes open on the table. 
The next player in turn has the choice: a/ follow = play as many cards (min.1) of the same value as played, and pass this on to the next player; 
or b/ counter = play as many cards (min.1) of a different value so that the total amount of the cards is higher than the total amount of the cards played by the starting player. 
If the player can't do neither option a nor b, then he has to take all cards as penalty points.
Of course there are some Joker-cards, which allow the players to avoid taking the penalty points. Some examples are: change the direction of play; take a card from the discard pile, take half of the penalty cards and move the rest on to the next player, ...

Name: Burg Flatterstein (reisespiele)
Description: Hurry to the top of old Castle Flutterstone to win the race for the magic cup! The only way to advance in this travel version of Burg Flatterstein, however, is to use the catapult to shoot the bats through the openings in the castle. Flutter to the right places, and you'll make your way to victory...

Name: Crazy Trains: The Game of Loco-Motion!
Description:
An exciting new family board game where everyone can enjoy the thrill of riding the rails!

You're riding the rails on a four-car train headed to New York City.  Be the first to safely guide your train into the Big Apple...and you WIN!

But it won't be EASY!  Along the way, you'll face many challenges including Competitor Trains and Curly the Conductor who's going to make this the...Craziest Trip Ever!

Curly's special Conductor Die must be rolled in addition to your dice of Coal, each roll bringing you closer OR farther away from your final destination.

With your skills as an "Engineer" and a little luck, you'll be unstoppable in your RACE to NYC!
So hop aboard and Conduct your way to Fun!

—description from the designer

Name: Pentaquark: QCD Pack 1 – Top Quarks
Description: Top Quarks is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. Played like other flavors of quarks, when a Top quark card is played it must be part of a confinement or it is discarded.

Name: Pentaquark: Colliders (Kickstarter edition)
Description:
Colliders is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. One of three condition cards are drawn the beginning of the game to aid you in your efforts.

This entry is for the Kickstarter edition, which contains ALICE, ATLAS and LHCb Colliders.

Name: In the Loop
Description:
"Getting the necessary signatures to build the elevated train took both cash and guile." -- Charles Yerkes, Chicago, 1894

It is the 1880’s, and Chicago rises like a phoenix from the ashes of the Great Fire. Rail is king in this city on the grow. As a power broker, your pockets are lined by train companies competing to build the new elevated rail system, “The Loop.” In this game, players work together to build the loop while hiding which line they work for, because everyone is scheming for a big piece of this corruption pie.
 In the Loop is a 2-4 player game of puzzle building, tactical planning, and secret motives.

Objective: Line your pockets by connecting lines and working to make your line the best. You earn money in two ways: during gameplay, you earn money by connecting lines to route cards. After the game has finished, you earn additional money from the syndicate you secretly work for. Don’t let other players deduce who you’re working for or they will try to block you. The game ends shortly after the Loop has been completed.
 Quick gameplay summary: On your turn, you will place two line cards and one route card. You can also spend your money to make bribes to buy cards or remove previously played cards. Keep in mind that the winner is the player with the most money in the end, so spend wisely! Each turn, you will earn money for each line that connects to the route card you played, and at the end of the game, you will earn money for each time your line appears and each time it connects to a station. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alien vs Predator: Alien Stalkers
Description:
Different kind of animal, the fastest one of the brood.
—description from the publisher

Name: Tanks: Sherman (Early)
Description:
The M4 Medium Tank, aka the Sherman, was the
most iconic American tank of WWII. It was well
protected, mobile and reliable, and remained the
main tank in US armored divisions throughout the
war, with a total of more than 44,000 produced.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Sherman
(early) tank
1x Sherman (early) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Tanks: Stuart
Description:
The M3 Stuart was mechanically reliable, and even thought it had lighter armor and a smaller gun than the latest German Panthers, its small size and high speed made it well suited to probing enemy defences and fighting a free-wheeling and wild style of moving battle.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Stuart tank
1x Stuart tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Advanced Realm Warfare
Description:
The Advanced Real Warfare expansion adds up to four players to the basic game.  Four board extensions are added around the circumference of the basic board.  As with the basic teams, the advanced teams all have unique abilities, strengths, and weaknesses.  Advanced teams feature more offensive capabilities and less defensive capabilities than the base teams.  Each advanced team starts with a facing that opposes two of the base game teams.

—user summary

Name: 9Apr40:  Norge angrepet!
Description:
Basically regiment to brigade level fast, simple game of the April-June 1940 campaign in Norway.  7 10-day turns.  Area movement.  Has Norway Unprepared and Nazi Treachery/Surprise rules, as well as variants cancelling one or both of those, to show the difference (unhistorical) preparedness and alertness could have made. (My 7 yr old Norwegian-American daughter took a look at all the historically initially upside-down/Disrupted/un-mobilized Norwegian units and opined that they were "sleeping.")

Basic game - naval warships/units abstracted - is chess-like.  The Advanced game - including naval units, although non-Norwegian naval forces are still somewhat abstracted - is still relatively simple, but takes about twice as long.

I am very proud of my pixel-by-pixel ship, aircraft, and tank unit icons, especially the little Norwegian Army Air Service Gloster Gladiator with insignia.

The game was designed with the research assistance of a librarian in the excellent Defence Museum in Akershus Festing/Fortress, Norway's Pentagon.

Lots of possible event outcomes make the game enjoyable for solitaire play as well.

Very simple combat mechanics, including an innovative ground combat system.

Has map also divided into 3 sections to enable magnum-sized copy of game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chivalry at Bay: Tactical Battles of the Hundred Years War
Description:
"As God may help, it appears to me that all the flower and honor of chivalry is there, most wisely and expertly drawn up." -- John Chandos, before the Battle of Auray (29 September 1364)

The Hundred Years War (1337 to 1453) was a dynastic struggle between the English house of Plantagenet and the French house of Valois for control of the French throne. Armies from across Europe would ally with these families, spreading combat as far from Gascony as Scotland and Portugal. Chivalry rose and fell on the backs of personalities like the Black Prince, Charles the Bad, and Pedro the Cruel, fought over battlefields at Creçy, Poitiers, and Agincourt. By the end of this period, the military code of chivalry would be in ashes and from those would be born the nations of England and France.

Chivalry At Bay is a low to medium complexity game depicting many of the individual battles that made up the Hundred Years War. Players control armies involved in each conflict that attempt to drive their opponent from the field of battle. Each battle can be completed in roughly two hours, allowing several battles to be played in a single sitting. The game takes several novel approaches toward simulating these eighteen individual battles:

LA CAPELLE (HYPOTHETICAL) - 23 October 1339
SAINT-OMER - 26 July 1340
MORLAIX - 30 September 1342
AUBEROCHE - 21 October 1345
BLANCHETAQUE - 24 August 1346
CREÇY - 26 August 1346
NEVILLE’S CROSS - 17 October 1346
CASSEL - 8 June 1347
BÉTHUNE - 13 June 1347
POITIERS - 19 September 1356
COCHEREL - 16 May 1364
AURAY - 29 September 1364
NAJERA - 3 April 1367
PONTVALLAIN - 4 December 1370
ROOSEBEKE - 27 November 1382
ALJUBARROTA - 14 August 1385
HUMBLETON HILL - 14 September 1402
AGINCOURT - 25 October 1415

Rather than the typical hex-based movement system, Chivalry At Bay uses a map that is broken up into three individual columns (or "battles" to use the historical term), each of which is made up of five "ranks" ranging from a friendly rear area, to and advance area, central area, through the enemy advance and rear areas. Units move backwards and forwards through these areas to more accurately simulate the type of movement that took place historically as waves of knights and men-at-arms advanced and were thrown back by enemy defenders (such as the feared English bowmen). Special terrain tiles may be placed in specific areas to more accurately simulate the ground over which the armies fought.

Combat is a simple process involving a "buckets-of-dice" system where "hits" on enemy units are based upon a unit's ability rating. Units range from lowly levies to the cream of chivalry, the French knight. Also represented are long bowmen, crossbowmen, men-at-arms, bill and pikemen, and light cavalry. Units that take hits may withdraw towards their friendly areas or hold their position and be ground down by the enemy onslaught. Units that have sustained enough damage may rout from the field!


The core of the game system is a deck of action cards. Each card provides a random number of command points that army leaders use to activate units on the battlefield to advance into engagement or withdraw before they're destroyed. The number of cards a player has available is based upon the quality of the army leadership. Several of these cards also allow the opportunity for players to "purchase" temporary army enhancements such as increased unit ratings or combat bonuses or even events that can shift the momentum of a battle.

In addition to the eighteen historical battles depicted, Chivalry At Bay provides players the ability to quickly and easily create their own custom armies to experiment with tactics and fight out battles on their own terms.

From La Capelle to Agincourt, relive the blood and glory of the Hundred Years War with Chivalry At Bay!

SUN OF YORK OWNERS! Use the fully mounted map board and game pieces of Chivalry at Bay to bring your Sun of York game alive! Now you can finally have that compact table top experience for the Wars of the Roses you’ve been asking for. We’ve listened, and you’ll love the new gaming experience.


Components:
 Mounted Playing Surface/Mapboard
Counter Sheets (x4.5)
Terrain Tiles Sheets (x3)
55-Card Decks (x2)
Six-Sided Dice (x6)
Player Aid Cards (x2)

Time Scale: 5-10 minutes per turn
Map Scale: Abstract
Unit Scale: Leaders and 50-500 troops
Number of Players: 2

Name: Putin Moves South
Description:
Putin Moves South is an operational-strategic level two-player wargame covering a hypothetical struggle between Russia and a coalition of opposing states to gain control of Central Asia, encompassing the area from the Russian frontier to the Persian Gulf. Combatants include, Russian, NATO, Chinese, Iranian, and various Central Asian States including the Persian Gulf countries.

The game system models the situation at the highest strategic level. Using a variation of Ty Bomba's Putin's War (MW #29). Units represent operational task forces of corps size; Special Forces; airpower, and cyberwar. The game system models operations in a vast theater with limited infrastructure and with coalition forces that all have divergent political aims.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chechen War: 1994 - 1996
Description:
Eternal War is an operational-strategic level two-player simulation of the 1st Chechnya War (1994-1996) wherein the Russian Federation under Boris Yeltsin attempted to directly and forcibly put an end to the Chechen independence movement. The Russian player must deal with low morale at the front and at home to win the war to keep Chechnya within the Russian Federation. The Chechen player is outgunned and outnumbered, but can wage an effective guerrilla campaign to bog down the entire Russian effort and thereby achieve independence. There is a total of nine game turns covering two years of conflict, from December 1994 to December 1996. The game map encompasses Chechnya and surrounding territories (Georgia, Ingushetia, Dagestan). Included on the counter sheet are Bonus counters for Modern War #1 (Red Dragon/Green Crescent), Modern War #18 (Green Beret), Modern War #21 (Kandahar) and errata counters for Modern War #17 (Dien Bien Phu).

—description from the publisher

Name: Sixth Fleet
Description:
Sixth Fleet is a two-player, strategic-level wargame of the struggle for the Mediterranean set during a hypothetical Warsaw Pact versus NATO war during the 1970s and 1980s. It is primarily a naval-air conflict, with some elements of power projection using ground forces. The game map represents various sea zones (or zones) within the Mediterranean, as well as adjoining land areas. Critical bases for both sides, including neutral nations are also depicted.

Aircraft units represent one to six squadrons, with the counter displaying the primary type of aircraft. Ship units represent one fleet aircraft carrier or battleship and “divisions” of four cruisers or nuclear-powered submarines with destroyers being represented in squadrons of six to eight destroyers or non-nuclear subs. Other ship types are represented at the division level and represent various numbers of ship types. On the map, each inch equals 20 miles. Each turn represents from one day to one week of activity, depending on the level of activity. Sixth Fleet is based on Red Dragon Rising. Changes have been made based on the situation in the Mediterranean during the Cold War.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun
Description:
The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun is a two-player operational-strategic-level wargame simulating a hypothetical Chinese invasion of Japan. The premise of this game is a sudden war has erupted on the Korean peninsula, compelling China to intervene in the conflict—this time well before the United States could reinforce South Korea sufficiently to prevent it from being overrun. The Chinese realize there may never be another opportunity to completely extirpate the US from the Asian mainland, they have irrevocably committed themselves to this path, and thus it is their resolute intention to finally settle old scores with the Empire of the Sun. The map covers the militarily significant terrain of Japan and surrounding areas. Each hex on the map equals ~36 miles (58 kilometers) from side to side. Each game turn represents about a week. Playing pieces represent divisions and brigades, as well as occasional regiments and even battalions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Central Pacific Campaign 1943-44
Description: "The Central Pacific Campaign" is a solitaire, strategic-level wargame of the struggle for control of the Central Pacific during World War II. The solitaire player is commanding the US forces and the system controls the Japanese forces. The player wins by accomplishing historic campaign milestones ahead of what was done historically, thereby opening the way for an earlier invasion of Okinawa or Formosa. Most ground units represent divisions, brigades or regiments. Aircraft units represent two groups or regiments (six to eight squadrons), and are each identified by the primary type of aircraft in those units. Ship units represent one fleet aircraft carrier, divisions of two light or escort carriers, two battleships, four cruisers, squadrons of six to eight destroyers and one light cruiser. The map is drawn to emphasize the strategically critical zones and islands in the Central Pacific. Each grid box on the map is 300 miles from side to side. Each turn represents one month.

Name: Rats of Tobruk
Description:
The Rats of Tobruk uses a derivative of the Famous Divisions Series that appeared in World at War #20 (Grossdeutschland Panzer <sic>) and #34 (Guards Armored). Rats of Tobruk is a two-player operational/tactical game that simulates Rommel’s Easter Day attack on Tobruk in April 1941. This battle primarily involved the Australian 9th Infantry Division, as well as British artillery batteries that were tasked to prevent the capture of Tobruk harbor by the German 5th Light Division. Each game turn represents approximately six hours. Game turns are not divided into separate friendly and enemy turns, but rather they are comprised of numerous individual headquarters activations. The map represents the western half of the Tobruk fortifications in 1941. Each hexagon encompasses about 500 meters.

Published in World at War #64 magazine, the FEB – MAR 2019 issue.

Name: Operation Typhoon
Description:
Operation Typhoon is a solitaire operational-strategic simulation that covers the final advance toward Moscow of Germany’s Army Group Center late in 1941. The player actively commands the German forces, while the rules system directs you in the handling of Soviet forces. The system allows the player to plan and execute his advance towards Moscow with the Soviet defending forces being randomly created in each hex dependent on the terrain. You win or lose, ultimately, based on the timely seizure of key areas on the map. Each game turn equals one or two weeks. Each hexagon represents 7.5 miles (12 km) from side to opposite side.

Though designed for solitaire play, Operation Typhoon is easily adaptable to cooperative team play. One person can administratively handle the Soviets while the other actively commands the German force. Alternatively, one player can command the three northern German armies and panzer groups while the other commands the three southern formations. The game map represents the terrain in the operational area of Moscow, with each unit representing the historical German divisions and generic randomly generated Soviet defending forces.

Uses the Panzers East solitaire system.

World at War #65, April-May 2019

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of Changsha: Sept. 1941 - Jan. 1942
Description:
The Battle of Changsha is a two-player, operational level game of the second (September to October 1941) battle for Changsha, China, capital of the Hunan Province. The second battle in 1941, resulted in the city being captured by the Japanese, and then being recaptured by the Chinese 9th Army Group commanded by Gen. Xue Yue. The third battle was originally intended by the Japanese to gain control of the city and prevent Chinese forces from reinforcing the British forces engaged in the defense of Hong Kong. When Hong Kong fell on 25 December, the Japanese decided to continue the offensive to gain control of Changsha thereby dealing a major blow to the Chines war effort. Ground units represent battalions and regiments with artillery and Japanese air power being represented with the use of fire support markers. Each hex is 3km across and each game turn represents 1 to 2 days.

—description from the publisher

Name: Persian Wars
Description:
Persian Wars is a card-driven wargame depicting the Greco-Persian conflict from 494 to 466 B.C. Players control either the Persian empire and its generals, Xerxes, Artabazus, Artayntes, Artemisia and Mardonius or the Greek city-states and their generals, the Athenians Xanthippus, Miltiades and Themistocles and Spartans, Leonidas and Pausanias. The game is divided in two periods of 7 rounds each. During the first period, from 494 to 480 BC, the Persians are on the offensive, unleashing their invasion in Asia Minor, Thrace and the rest of the Greek peninsula, with their goal to conquer citites from their secret Objective card, while the Greeks try to prevent them from doing so. Once the first period is over, the Persian side announces the number of cities conquered from its objective. Moving to the second period, from 480 o 466 BC, the Greeks mount a counterattack, in an attempt to liberate as many cities as they can from their secret Objective card. In a similar fashion, the Persians try to prevent the Greeks from achieving their goal. With the second period over, the Greek side announces the number of cities liberated from its objective. The number of cities conquered/liberated are compared and the side with the most cities conquered/liberated wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Drop Everything
Description:
An abstract game of Alex Randolph. It's an evolution of Foxy (1977) adapted also for 4 players.
The board is a grid with 44 holes where the players try dropping the discs from their tube-like.
In 2 players game, each player has 2 tube-like with 11 discs each.
First player to "drop everything" (both his tubes empty) wins
the game.

—user summary
